{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37451].
  {panel}

When I execute the below command, I am getting an error which I am not able to resolve

jira.bat --action=progressIssue --user=<uname> --password=<upwd> --issue=WIZARD-2489 --step=Resolve --comment="Resolved by \n ABCD"

Reponse is :
Remote error: com.atlassian.jira.rpc.exception.RemoteException: Error occurred w
hen running workflow action Resolve:
Errors: {comment=Comment is required.}
Error Messages: []

Question:
I have provided the comment parameter and value, but still it's complaining.

--comment parameter is not mandatory as per the JIRA CLI documentation,    I think in our project settings they have made it mandatory to provide comment when moving from "open" to "resolve" in our workflow.

But providing the "comment" is not helping either


******************************************************************************************

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37444].
  {panel}

The following documentation needs to be corrected specifically for OnDemand where the Source or Commits tab was replaced by the Development section documented here: [Streamlining your development with JIRA OnDemand|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Streamlining+your+development+with+JIRA+OnDemand]
Also found in the [What's New|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/What's+New] (section: Visibility into the status of builds and deployments related to a JIRA issue)

* This documentation still mentions the Source tab under the "View Development Tools" permission: [Managing Project Permissions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Managing+Project+Permissions]

* And this one mentions the Commits tab in the first paragraph: [Getting started with Bitbucket and OnDemand|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Getting+started+with+Bitbucket+and+OnDemand]

Affects: JIRA 6.2-OD-10-004-WN

Let me know if you need any more info.
fields.summary: Request: Update documentation related to the Commit/Source tab replaced with the Development section in OnDemand

fields.description:
Usually Activity Stream will display all the comments correctly. However, upon restoring data from a backup, the following actions will lead to this issue:
* Add a new dashboard
* Add Activity Stream gadget to this dashboard
* Use the following filters:
!filter.png|thumbnail!

As observed, only the comments from the *two most updated issues* will be displayed (not limited to only 2 comments):
!twoissues.png|thumbnail!

Here's to show EMS-71 and EMS-68 as the two most updated issues (the other issues have no comments to be displayed):
!mostupdated.png|thumbnail!

In fact, there're issues with comments not being displayed (including sub-task):
!othercmt1.png|thumbnail!

!othercmt2.png|thumbnail!

If we update an issue whose comments are not displayed, e.g. EMS-37 in this case, all the comments will become visible:
!updated.png|thumbnail!
(the issue becomes most updated after its second comment is edited)

!gadgetupdated.png|thumbnail!
(all of the comments become visible)

h4. Expected behavior
Comments should be visible all the time according to the filters.
fields.summary: Activity Stream displays "Comment added" activity incorrectly upon restoring backup data
PermissionValidator throws NPE when attempting to transition as anonymous user

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37440].
  {panel}

Currently the sort order only adheres to:
1. 'Natural' — this will use the field's native sorting order, e.g. for the "Assignee" field, the assignee names would be sorted alphabetically.
2. 'Total' — this will sort by the number of issues that match each value, e.g. for the "Assignee" field, the assignee names would be sorted by the number of issues assigned to each person.

Regardless of the JQL filter.

Allowing to sort, and group based on the workflow status should be an added improvement to this widget for the future.
fields.summary: Dashboard Widget: Allow sorting and grouping by workflow status

fields.description:
An extremely long comment that is posted in a JIRA issue will cause the notification detail screen to be cut-off.  Therefore, you cannot get to the close button at the bottom because there is not any scrolling in the detail screen.  The only way to get out of the notification detail screen is to press escape.

To recreate this issue, please follow these steps.
1. Post a comment in an issue that is excessively long.  I have found that comments exceeding 50 lines will cause this issue.  Not sure if 50 is the cut off or not.
2. Check the the notifications in the toolbar at the top of your window.
3. Find your commented entry and click on it.
4. Pop-up detail box will appear and the close at the bottom of the screen is pushed down off of the screen.  

See attached screenshot.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Notification detail screen is cut-off due to issue comment being too long.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37428].
  {panel}

As per the title of this bug ticket, the CSV import feature only respect the time zone of the server which in the case of On Demand customers, they have no control over the server time zone and causes discrepancy on their instance. 

*Example Use Case*
Customer generate csv file from the local instance/applications and the time exported is based on customer time zone (GMT+8) and customer import this generated csv file to an On Demand instance.

Expected, the time zone will be respected based on the setting of General Configuration > System Time Zone which user have access to. 

Actual, it disrespect and actually stored the time on the default time zone of the server (UTC+0), so having configuration of GMT+8 will cause discrepancy on the On Demand instance.

*Steps to Reproduce*

# Set the time zone of the JIRA On Demand instance to any time zone (+8)
# Perform a CSV import with the created time (2013-11-26 11:30)
# Notice that the time updated on the issue is (26/Nov/13 7:30 PM) instead

*Note*

This should not be a high priority issue for self installed version of JIRA as this can be worked around by setting the server time zone to respect the time. But for On Demand customers this is not possible.

*Suggestion*

To have a drop down for selection on csv import that can choose the time zone accordingly for On Demand customers.
fields.summary: CSV Import Only Respect Server Time Zone

fields.description:
Custom JQL added by addons cannot be used in the REST API until used at least once interactively in the UI (By a filter being executed with it, or a human typing in the query).  This issue presents itself after every restart of the server, which leads me to think it is some sort of caching issue.

Steps to reproduce:

Install addon as described here:  https://developer.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/Adding+a+JQL+Function+to+JIRA
Stop server
Start server
Query the search rest endpoint with /rest/api/2/search?jql=project+in+recentProjects()
Error
Open browser, navigate to issue search
Search for project in recentProjects()
Success
Re-query the rest API
Success
fields.summary: Custom JQL functions cannot be used with REST API until used once in UI

fields.summary: Redmine importer should not have it's own menu header

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37422].
  {panel}

h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new directory in Crowd and add users into this directory
# Define a Password Regex for the directory (for example: {{[A-Za-z0-9]{3,}}} which means passwords need to be at least 3 characters)
# Define Password Complexity Requirement Message for the directory
# Create a JIRA application in Crowd and add the directory into this application
# Create a new Crowd directory in JIRA and synchronize the users into JIRA
# Log into JIRA as one of the users residing in Crowd directory
# Change the password. Set the password to 2 characters only

h4. Expected Results
JIRA should show the "Password Complexity Requirement Message"

h4. Actual Results
JIRA shows the following instead, which is not user-friendly:
{quote}The password could not be changed by the credentials provider. com.atlassian.crowd.exception.InvalidCredentialException: The new password does not meet the directory complexity requirements: <THIS IS PWD COMP REQ MESSAGE>{quote}
fields.summary: The error message shown when changing a password that does not meet the directory complexity requirements is not user-friendly

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37421].
  {panel}

In the TimeSheet Report, clicking in the hours shown in an Issue that is closed, shows a Permission Error. (see attached image for details)

*Cause:*
The link points to /secure/UpdateWorklog!default.jspa?id=etc.. and the option to Update the Worklog seems to be disabled after closing the issue.
The same function is called when clicking on the Pencil-icon next to a Work Log entry in an unresolved issue. That icon disappears when closing the issue and trying to access that same page, gives a Permission Error.
fields.summary: Timesheet Report links displays permission problem when clicking on worklog

All other integrations between jira and concluence still seem to work fine.

I changed the application url from a domain name to localhost when I updated to jira 6.2 (jira and confluence are public - running behind a apache proxy) Yet, I reverted this change and the exception was still thrown. 
I also made sure that jira as well as confluence both have the necessary SSL certificate in their store.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37413].
  {panel}

The latest version of JIRA 6.x has made some major UI changes which while the make it faster and maybe look a little cooler make it much more difficult to actually use.

When updating a list of issues:

- a little lightbox comes up to tell me changes have been to the very
record I was intending to change (duh!)
- the updated data does not refresh on the list (which was my original
complaint but which they claim is acceptable UI behavior)
- nothing about the list itself even updates (e.g., the fact that the
link was clicked on isn't even registered (which is standard web UI
behavior) which would at least provide feedback to the end-user that they
have touched that record as they are working through the list. I should at
*least* see the listline link display change so that as I work through
the list I can tell where I left off.)
fields.summary: Visually Update UI when records are updated

fields.description:
*Reproduction*:

1. Perform a slow query such as this:
{noformat}
status was not in (Resolved, Closed) on "2013/07/01" AND status was in (Resolved, Closed) on "2013/10/01"
{noformat}

2. Open the JIRA issue from the list.

3. Click the *Issues* dropdown. The drop-down will not appear until the search we did in Step #1 repeats, and completes. 

!Selection_155.png!

On version 6.1.7, I also observe that *Viewing* an issue also repeats the slow search. On JAC, it's not reproducible so maybe that's been fixed.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37396].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, project lead unable to edit group membership in JIRA. Only user with JIRA Administrators or JIRA System Administrators can edit user groups. In corporate settings with many non-public projects it would be helpful to be able to delegate the management of group memberships to project leads in order to relieve jira-admins of this task.

h3. Suggested Solution
Creation of user group will still be under JIRA Administrators or JIRA System Administrators, but Project Lead can add/remove users in the user groups. Better still, if there is "membership-edit" permission, so that JIRA Administrators or JIRA System Administrators can grant such permission to the respective Project Lead can perform add/remove users.

The attachment option in JIRA has vague filename restrictions, and rejects uploads if the filename contains certain characters.

This is kinda frustrating behaviour, and I'd suggest it would be more useful if JIRA would sanitise inputs rather than just slamming the door.

!Screenshot from 2014-03-07 11_42_21.png!

Steps to reproduce:

# Create a file on the disk called "Screenshot from 2014-03-07 11:42:21.png"
# Attempt to attach this to a JIRA task.

Expected behaviour: The file uploads and gets renamed if necessary.
Actual behaviour: The file doesn't upload and I receive an error.

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce:
# Create a *Custom Field*
# Insert _This is a Custom Field_ to the description
# Create new *Field Configuration* and *Field Configuration Scheme*
# Associate the new *Field Configuration Scheme* to a *Project*
# Create an Issue, the description shows _This is a Custom Field_
# Edit the description again in the Custom Field page, _This is NOT a Custom Field_
# Create/edit an Issue, the description is not updated, still showing _This is a Custom Field_
_This is a Custom Field_ is a description in the *Field Configuration*

h3. Additional steps:
# Edit the description in the Field Configuration and leave it *blank*
# JIRA will retrieve the current description from the Custom Field
# Edit the description in the Custom Field
# Create/edit an issue, changes were not reflected

h3. Expected Result:
When an Administrator made a changes to the Custom Field description, the changes should be reflected in the screen.

h3. Actual Result:
The changes was not reflected, JIRA retains the description from the Field Configuration.
fields.summary: Custom Field's description will be overridden with the description in Field Configuration

fields.description:
Copy the Confluence version of the same thing. They have a much better pattern.

In technical terms this is a violation but I'm a user who was sent a link to this page so I haven't really violated anything. Please make it more human.

!http://monosnap.com/image/nJlDtqFaPXnhcDbGieIQnO3UigXfGg.png!

[~humphreybc] maybe this can be handled in the ADG with error pages?
fields.summary: Permission violation page is not well designed and user friendly
Provide an option to Collapse the Navigation Bar

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37358].
  {panel}

h4. Steps to repro:
1. Create some custom fields and use them in a workflow
2. Export the workflow from JIRA
3. Import the same workflow back in

h4. Expected:
No new fields should be created since the same type of custom field, with the same name already exists

h4. Actual:
A new set of custom fields is created.
fields.summary: Workflow import creates duplicate custom fields

fields.summary: After JIRA 6.2 Upgrade Unable to resolve JIRA Board Issues

fields.description:
The 'Commits' tab has been missing from our OnDemand Jira site since (at least) the 1st week of January 2014. We really rely on this tab to easily be able to view/QA the commits for each ticket, and we haven't been able to use this feature for over two months now.

This issue says this bug is resolved (https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-36448), but the problem still persists in our Jira instance/site.  

We are using JIRA v6.2-OD-10-004-WN
https://blinkx.atlassian.net

Please advise, thanks.
fields.summary: JIRA OnDemand still not receiving commit messages from Bitbucket
Agile Board Filters Should Use Project Key

fields.description:
We are using a URL Like:
https://jira.....com/jira/secure/CreateIssueDetails!init.jspa?pid=13302&issuetype=12
in order to create a JIRA ISSUE.

What is happening is that when the user clicks on the link, the Form of the creation fields (custom or normal) is submitted automatically at the first click.

This causes the display of ERRORS (Missing required Fields). which is not relevant in our case, because the user didn't have the oppurtunity to yet enter any field value.

We think it is a Bug. 
It is possible to not have the first automatic form validation? and therefor have a normal create screen form.
Can you please do something?we really need this feature.
fields.summary: Why CreateIssueDetails!init.jspa ( Create an issue From a URL) The form is automatically submitted?
Reinstate clickable tabs?
Display a warning message if some comments will be hidden after moving an issue
Update the description of Remote API in General Configuration

*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Create a Test Project.
# Create some issues assigned to a single user and with the "Original Estimate" filled with value.
# Create a version and assigned it to those issues.
# Choose one of the issus and close it.
# Go to Project Overview page and click the Report tab.
# Choose the Version Workload Report.
# Select the version that have an issue closed before.

*Expected Behaviour:*
The Information displayed will be aligned properly regardless how many issue type in the projects and the browser window size.

*Actual Result:*
If there a lot of issue types in the project, the column will go through the webpage layout leaving a grey zone. The individual Estimates in bottom is not aligned properly.
!VersionWorkloadRep.png|width=30%!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37340].
  {panel}

It would be great to have a feature to set a comment's visibility/restriction when generating it from an email.

Couple of ideas that I can think about:
* Setting a specific keyword in the email (much like the delimeter option for the handler *Add a comment before a specified marker or separator in the email body*)
* An option when creating a handler; paired with a specific email address that users send emails to for comment creation.
fields.summary: Ability to Set Comment Visibility when Creating Comments via Email

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37338].
  {panel}

Currently the documentation https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Restoring+Data has a lot of detail regarding an xml backup restore, but not much around a native backup restore. It simply says that native database backups are doing using native database tools.

We probably need to make sure that it mentions:

# JIRA should not be running at the time of the restore
# You should restore the home directory from the time the database backup was taken, too
# If you have no home directory backup, or current home directory from the future relative to the backup, then make mention of the data that gets lost, for example attachments, indexes, installed plugins
# Make mention that restoring to a future version of the home directory compared to the database backup will require a full locking reindex, as the index will be totally out-of-sync. Everything else would likely work, though there may be unlinked attachments, and plugins which have been installed since the backup which will revert to a fresh install
fields.summary: Restoring Data documentation needs more detail on steps around restoring a native database backup

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37337].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

We're seeing an increasing number of issues where customers are reporting initial page load times in excess of 10-15 seconds, and sometimes more.

h3. Cause

When accessing a page within JIRA, a set of {{batch.js}} and {{batch.css}} files are provided that contain the batched Javascript and CSS resources for the page. Upon first load of a page this cache is created (if it does not already exist on the server), and is then stored for future loads of the page. This cache is a server-side cache and is separate from the client-side cache (ie the cached {{batch.js}} and {{batch.css}} files in the browser). The creation of the cache can take some time - 10 to 15 seconds - so on first load of a page it will take some time for the page to load.

On first load of any page in JIRA it does download quite a lot of content, which is then cached in the browser, so it is expected that the first page-load will be longer than any subsequent page loads. This is exacerbated when the cache is being recreated as it adds even more time onto that page load. 

The cache is created on a language/locale basis, so for example if users access a page in English it will be generated, and other users access pages in Russian it will be generated again. The cache is invalidated when there are Look & Feel changes, or plugin changes occur. This means if these changes occur the cache will need to be recreated and will cause page load times to increase until the cache is created and stored server-side. If there are users with a variety of different languages using the server it will mean the cache is recreated multiple times.

In certain cases where multiple concurrent requests take place they can end up all running the batch generation simultaneously, leading to the CPU spiking and the instance potentially becoming unresponsive while all the requests are processed. 

Once a type of page has been visited per user (e.g. the dashboard, a JIRA issue or a project page) the {{batch.css}} will be cached for that type of page until the next restart or plugin change. So the first time you view one of these pages the performance will be slow, but it will improve significantly on each subsequent visit.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Go to any JIRA instance - this can be easily replicated with a jira-dev instance
# Disable or enable a plugin
# Load the dashboard

Looking at the Network tab of developer tools, you'll see that there's a long delay in loading those batch files.

h3. Workaround

Schedule plugin changes during off-peak periods, and then visit a page in JIRA to ensure the cache is recreated during that off-peak period.

(!) *Note:* It is always best practice to schedule plugin installations and upgrades in off-peak periods or during maintenance windows. For JIRA Download customers it is also recommended to perform major plugin changes on a staging instance before it is done on a live environment. 

h3. Diagnosis

For one of the ways of identifying this problem, this will show us the number of threads waiting to process LESS compilation. A higher number over a series of thread dumps can be considered bad.

The below is being executed in a folder with a significant number of thread dumps labelled jstack that were taken over a series of days.

{noformat}
$ grep -B1 "com.atlassian.plugin.cache.filecache.impl.CachedFile.stream" jstack* |grep "waiting to lock" |awk '{print $1}' | sort |uniq -c
  31 jstack.13007.110759.851358689-
  58 jstack.13007.110810.528822009-
  54 jstack.13007.110821.172461523-
  42 jstack.4440.threadHigh.103649.939600529-
  44 jstack.4440.threadHigh.103701.620551473-
  48 jstack.4440.threadHigh.103713.178859435-
  51 jstack.4440.threadHigh.103724.736087099-
  57 jstack.4440.threadHigh.103736.376659166-
{noformat}

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37336].
  {panel}

As explained in the document [Advanced Use of the Issue Collector|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Advanced+Use+of+the+JIRA+Issue+Collector#AdvancedUseoftheJIRAIssueCollector-Islocalizationofanissuecollectorpossible?]:
{quote}
# The issue collector strings set by the JIRA Administrator
# Either the default language setting for JIRA, or the language preference of the user if they are logged in to JIRA.
- All users will see the names of the fields as they are set by the JIRA Administrator.  These are not affected by the default language of JIRA, and are not affected by the default language of logged in JIRA users.
- All users will see the field descriptions as they are set in the JIRA Administration UI.
- For everything else:
-- Anonymous users will see everything else in the default JIRA language.
-- Logged in users will see everything else in the feedback form in the language specified by their JIRA profile.
{quote}

It is possible to localize the language for logged in users according to their profile language.
It would be good to have the possibility to localize the issue collector default strings according to e.g. the user's browser language.
fields.summary: Issue Collector Localization

fields.description:
I have two issues which were created on February 28th before noon which does not show up in the Search Results.

Steps to Reproduce:
Create an issue on the last day of the month
Search for shipments as below (example has February dates)

project = ITDS AND issuetype = Defect AND created >= 2014-02-01 AND created <= 2014-02-28 AND "Environment Tested" = Production ORDER BY created DESC, status DESC, key DESC

Actual Results:
Issues created on 28th February did not show up in the Search Results

Expected Results:
Issues created on 1st Feb and 28th Feb and all issues created in between need to be displayed in the search results.

Note: Reports I sent out to my team members were inaccurate because of this issue.
fields.summary: Created <= date is not coming back with the issues created on that date
Update our Finding your Server ID documentation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37333].
  {panel}

*Background of The Request*

Although we do provide a detailed information regarding [User Management Limitation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/User+Management+Limitations+and+Recommendations] there are customer who does not aware of such limitation and integrate Confluence against a huge user base on their LDAP server.

This implementation can cause Confluence synchronization to run forever which could be avoided if a synchronization time limit is implemented and configurable by the administrators.

Another cause of unstoppable synchronization is due to corrupted cache.
fields.summary: Provide Option to Limit Directory Synchronization Time

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37330].
  {panel}

We have our custom filed Epic Name locked and we have included only epic with the issue type, but for some reason we see user story also getting included in the issue types, we have removed the user story issue types but on many occasion with out changing any configuration we end up having the same issue and it becomes impossible to create a user story without proving the epic Name

The issue has occured more than 3 times please let me know if this is any known issue and let me know if there is any permenant fix for this.

Let me know if you need more information.

BR

Ravish Raju
fields.summary: Epic Name is Mandatory even while creating user story.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-37329].
  {panel}

I imported my data from JIRA 6.1.5 where I had defined custom checkbox. 
First time it shows up normally. I had both check boxes selected.
1. I deselected "two" from issue screen, everything still is OK as in Screenshot1.png
2. When I want to edit it again, I see them overlapping with "two" in front of "one" without any possibility to check or un-check "one". I can still check "two". See Screenshot2.png

I am not sure if it helps, but I attached Screenshot3.png that shows configuration of this checkbox field.

Kind regards,
Lauma
fields.summary: Checkboxes overlapping in JIRA 6.2
